column4: i'd like to hear from someone who has set up vmware server 2 beta and had issues with port 903 and how you fixed it please..
installed onto local pc.. using local browser.. the xinet environment appears to be configured to accept 903
,does the port show up with netstat, does it listen on local/public or both,is it blocked by the firewall, can you connect with nc?
no, no, dont think I have a firewall by default with ubuntu ?, nc not sure but telnet localhost 903 doesnt work.
maybe, it clearly isnt listening then, and yes by defauly ubuntu does not come with a firewall on
so even if its setup to use an xinet process its supposed to be listening? thought inet stuff just accepted when a request occurs.. rather than perm listens.
in order to accept a request it has to be listening

the fact that I am getting localhost [127.0.0.1] 903 (vmware-authd) : Connection refused -  this indicates that xinet is working right.. and pasisng the request thru to the right daemon.. so there must be a permisions or config issue with vmware-authd ?
if the deamon refuses the connection it definitly is a vmware conf issue
the joys that brings in and of itself :P
maybe it comes with network connections disabled by default, but that seems rather an odd thing to do
o.O I had to do sudo aptitude reinstall xinetd
ya!! very! :)  found it in here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VMware/Server
